Purging SmartVision Data
text: In most companies Purging would normally be carried out on an annual basis, and we would advise the following sequence. In some situations, more frequent purging of certain areas may be required and in this case, not all purge routines may be required. The SmartVision purge processes delete the records selected from the system therefor a backup of the SQL database must be take BEFORE purging it. (change the name of the backup to include descriptive text relevant to pre purging) System Manager>Batch>Purge MTD/YTD Data Materials>Inventory Control>Batch>Purge Part Stock Materials>Inventory Control>Batch>Purge Lot Data Materials>Inventory Control>Batch>Purge Serial Numbers Customer>Sales Order Processing>Batch>Purge Sales Orders Customer>Sales Order Processing>Batch>Purge Invoices Materials>Master Scheduling>Batch>Purge Master Schedule Orders Production>Shop Floor Execution>Batch>Purge Shop Orders Production>Shop Floor Execution>Batch>Purge Time Tickets Production>Shop Floor Execution>Batch>Purge Employee Work Materials>Purchasing Control>Batch>Purge Purchase Orders Materials>Purchasing Control>Batch>Purge Purchase Requisitions Materials>Purchasing Control>Batch>Purge Vouchers Finance>Costing>Batch>Purge Work GL Materials>Inventory Control>Batch>Purge Transaction History Backup the database AFTER purging it (change the name of the backup to include descriptive text relevant to post purging
description:
In most companies Purging would normally be carried out on an annual basis, and we would advise the following sequence. In some situations, more frequent purging of certain areas may be required and in this case, not all purge routines may be required.


The SmartVision purge processes delete the records selected from the system therefor a backup of the SQL database must be take BEFORE purging it. (change the name of the backup to include descriptive text relevant to pre purging)


System Manager>Batch>Purge MTD/YTD Data


Materials>Inventory Control>Batch>Purge Part Stock


Materials>Inventory Control>Batch>Purge Lot Data


Materials>Inventory Control>Batch>Purge Serial Numbers


Customer>Sales Order Processing>Batch>Purge Sales Orders


Customer>Sales Order Processing>Batch>Purge Invoices


Materials>Master Scheduling>Batch>Purge Master Schedule Orders


Production>Shop Floor Execution>Batch>Purge Shop Orders


Production>Shop Floor Execution>Batch>Purge Time Tickets


Production>Shop Floor Execution>Batch>Purge Employee Work


Materials>Purchasing Control>Batch>Purge Purchase Orders


Materials>Purchasing Control>Batch>Purge Purchase Requisitions


Materials>Purchasing Control>Batch>Purge Vouchers


Finance>Costing>Batch>Purge Work GL


Materials>Inventory Control>Batch>Purge Transaction History


Backup the database AFTER purging it

(change the name of the backup to include descriptive text relevant to post purging

title: PIIM Error during processing - Type mismatch
text: Type mismatch error during the PIIM>Export Invoices process:- This message indicates that the software is not finding a value in the required field for the document number listed. On this example the Terms Code number of days field for PR - PRO-FORMA is blank:- To amend the field you need to open Vendor>Purchase Control>Activity>Purchase Data>PO Code Data>Terms Click the Terms Code for the list of Terms setup and enter the number of days and click Add:-
description:
Type mismatch error during the PIIM>Export Invoices process:-


This message indicates that the software is not finding a value in the required field for the document number listed.


On this example the Terms Code number of days field for PR - PRO-FORMA is blank:-



To amend the field you need to open Vendor>Purchase Control>Activity>Purchase Data>PO Code Data>Terms



Click the Terms Code for the list of Terms setup and enter the number of days and click Add:-

title: Setting up  a new user in SmartVision

description:

Select Maintain Users



Select Create


Enter the required details and select Default under Security Settings and Save

title: How to clear the SmartVision Temporary Files
text: To clear the SmartVision Temporary files you need to delete the files found in the trk and ss2 folders. The location of the files will depend on the version of SmartVision you are using as per the details below: - SmartVision 6.4 + The location used for several user-specific temporary files is located are in sub-folder beneath the user-specific Local Application Data folders. Local Application Data C:\Users\$USER$\AppData\Local\K3BTG\SmartVision If you are unable to see the AppData folder then it is hidden and you need to amend the View in windows Explorer by selecting View>Options>Show hidden files, folder, and drives: - The local sub-folders created by SmartVision are: dat Stores temporary files created when using the Assign function within the Purchasing Schedule. log Stores the issue log and error file created when performing issues within the Inventory Control module. out Stores the temporary posting reports created when posting Sales Orders, Vouchers and GL transactions in the Financial Integration module. ss2 Stores the temporary files which hold user grid preferences. There are the x*.ss2 files. The default grid settings files, *.ss2, are stred in the common application data folder. trk Stores files in which is saved the state of open, modeless Activity and Inquiry windows at the time an application is closed. Data in these files is then used to re-instate the window state when the corresponding application is next launched. SmartVision V5.4 - V6.3 The location used for several user-specific temporary files for SmartVision versions 5.4 to 6.3 are located in sub-folder beneath the user-specific Local Application Data folders. C:\ProgramData\K3BTG\SmartVision SmartVision V2.2 - V5.3 The location used for several user-specific temporary files for SmartVision versions 2.2 to 5.3 are located in the C:\Windows directory.
description:
To clear the SmartVision Temporary files you need to delete the files found in the trk and ss2 folders.


The location of the files will depend on the version of SmartVision you are using as per the details below: -


SmartVision 6.4 +


The location used for several user-specific temporary files is located are in sub-folder beneath the user-specific Local Application Data folders.


Local Application Data

C:\Users\$USER$\AppData\Local\K3BTG\SmartVision



If you are unable to see the AppData folder then it is hidden and you need to amend the View in windows Explorer by selecting View>Options>Show hidden files, folder, and drives: -


The local sub-folders created by SmartVision are:


dat

Stores temporary files created when using the Assign function within the Purchasing Schedule.


log

Stores the issue log and error file created when performing issues within the Inventory Control module.


out

Stores the temporary posting reports created when posting Sales Orders, Vouchers and GL transactions in the Financial Integration module.


ss2

Stores the temporary files which hold user grid preferences. There are the x*.ss2 files. The default grid settings files, *.ss2, are stred in the common application data folder.


trk

Stores files in which is saved the state of open, modeless Activity and Inquiry windows at the time an application is closed. Data in these files is then used to re-instate the window state when the corresponding application is next launched.


SmartVision V5.4 - V6.3


The location used for several user-specific temporary files for SmartVision versions 5.4 to 6.3 are located in sub-folder beneath the user-specific Local Application Data folders.


C:\ProgramData\K3BTG\SmartVision


SmartVision V2.2 - V5.3


The location used for several user-specific temporary files for SmartVision versions 2.2 to 5.3 are located in the C:\Windows directory.

title: SmartVision Costing Method
text: Costing Method: The Cost Per Unit for parts depends upon the Costing Method defined here. The three possible costing methods are: S = Standard costing A = Average costing P = Last purchase If the costing method is set to "S" (standard), the part cost comes from manual maintenance of Maintain Cost Data or as calculated by Recalculate Cost Rollups. Average costing is only used for Purchase Parts (B, D, Y). When receiving against a PO, if the costing method is average, then a new average cost is calculated as each purchase order is received. The Average Cost (AC) is calculated as: (PO Cost * Rec Qty) + (On Hand Qty * Part Master Cost) Rec Qty + On Hand Qty Receipt Quantity is converted from Purchasing units of measure to Cost unit of measure using the Purchase Cost Conversion. The Bill of Materials Unit of Measure is entered in Part Master. The Purchasing Unit is entered in Purchase Part Data. If P (last purchase) is entered as the costing method, each time a receipt is processed against a purchase order in Receipt To Stock, SmartVision writes the purchase order's unit cost to the part's material cost field stored in the part master file. The order's unit cost will replace the current standard cost with the latest purchase cost of the item. If, however, the cost set is not set to 00, but to a cost set 01-08, that cost set is written to instead of the part master file.
description:
Costing Method: The Cost Per Unit for parts depends upon the Costing Method defined here. The three possible costing methods are:


S = Standard costing

A = Average costing

P = Last purchase

 

If the costing method is set to "S" (standard), the part cost comes from manual maintenance of Maintain Cost Data or as calculated by Recalculate Cost Rollups. 

Average costing is only used for Purchase Parts (B, D, Y). When receiving against a PO, if the costing method is average, then a new average cost is calculated as each purchase order is received.


The Average Cost (AC) is calculated as:


(PO Cost * Rec Qty) + (On Hand Qty * Part Master Cost)

Rec Qty + On Hand Qty 


Receipt Quantity is converted from Purchasing units of measure to Cost unit of measure using the Purchase Cost Conversion.

The Bill of Materials Unit of Measure is entered in Part Master. The Purchasing Unit is entered in Purchase Part Data.


If P (last purchase) is entered as the costing method, each time a receipt is processed against a purchase order in Receipt To Stock, SmartVision writes the purchase order's unit cost to the part's material cost field stored in the part master file. The order's unit cost will replace the current standard cost with the latest purchase cost of the item. If, however, the cost set is not set to 00, but to a cost set 01-08, that cost set is written to instead of the part master file.

title: Upgrading the SmartVision client after a migration to a new server
text: Upgrading the SmV client after a migration to a new SmartVision server Open Windows Explorer and navigate to C:\Windows and delete MAXNET.INI file: - Open 32-bit ODBC and delete all SmartVision ODBCs: - Open Registry Editor and delete MircroMRP from Computer\HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\MicroMRP: - Run the SmV client upgrade by running setup.exe from the \\servername\K3btg\SmartVision\Net folder and follow the prompts: - Reboot the pc: - Right click the System Manager Client and select Run as administrator and this will create the new DSNs pointing to the new SmartVision server: - Click Yes: - Log into the SmartVision client: -
description:
Upgrading the SmV client after a migration to a new SmartVision server

 

Open Windows Explorer and navigate to C:\Windows and delete MAXNET.INI file: -



Open 32-bit ODBC and delete all SmartVision ODBCs: -


 

Open Registry Editor and delete MircroMRP from Computer\HKEY_CURRENT_USER\SOFTWARE\MicroMRP: -

 


Run the SmV client upgrade by running setup.exe from the \\servername\K3btg\SmartVision\Net folder and follow the prompts: -



Reboot the pc: -


Right click the System Manager Client and select Run as administrator and this will create the new DSNs pointing to the new SmartVision server: -





Click Yes: -

 

 

Log into the SmartVision client: -

title: Manage Period End
text: The SmartVision System Manager Client provides a facility to Manager Period End processing. This replaces the Purge MTD/YTD Data option of the classic SmartVision System Manager. The feature is accessed from the Batch Processor group within the ribbon: The Period End Manager Console dialog provides options to control the period end processes. Clear Out of Tolerance Counter - Check the Clear Out of Tolerance Counter option to clear the count of out of tolerance cycle counts in the [Part Master] table. Month-to-date - Check the required Month-to-date options to have month-to-date values cleared in the associated tables. (Details of values updated are provided further down). Year-to-date Check the required Year-to-date options to have year-to-date values cleared in the associated tables. (Details of values updated are provided further down). Performing a right-click in the area containing the Month-to-date and Year-to-date check boxes activates a Context Menu with options to Select All or Deselect All items at once. Status Information about processed records in shown under Status:- Status - Information about processed records in shown under Status. Process Mode - Select Generate Audit Reports Only to produce reports showing current cumulative values. - Select Clear Values with No Audit Reports to have cumulative values cleared without generating reports. - Select Generate Reports & Clear Values to produce reports showing current cumulative values and to subsequently clear the values. - If only the option to Clear Out of Tolerance Counter is selected, no report is produced and Process Mode selection is disabled. Process - Click the Process button to initiate period end processing. - Depending on the options selected, reports will be produced showing current cumulative values and / or cumulative values will be cleared. If any of the Process Modes which involve values being reset is selected, a confirmation dialog is displayed before values are cleared: - If any of the Process Modes which involve report generation is selected, a tabbed dialog showing reports for all selected tables is displayed. Select the required report in the left-hand pane for it to appear in the right-hand pane: - The report list will not be visible if a single table was selected for reporting: -
description:
The SmartVision System Manager Client provides a facility to Manager Period End processing. This replaces the Purge MTD/YTD Data option of the classic SmartVision System Manager.


The feature is accessed from the Batch Processor group within the ribbon: 



The Period End Manager Console dialog provides options to control the period end processes. 



Clear Out of Tolerance Counter - Check the Clear Out of Tolerance Counter option to clear the count of out of tolerance cycle counts in the [Part Master] table. 


Month-to-date - Check the required Month-to-date options to have month-to-date values cleared in the associated tables. (Details of values updated are provided further down). 


Year-to-date Check the required Year-to-date options to have year-to-date values cleared in the associated tables. (Details of values updated are provided further down). 


Performing a right-click in the area containing the Month-to-date and Year-to-date check boxes activates                                 a Context Menu with options to Select All or Deselect All items at once. Status Information about processed records in shown under Status:-


Status - Information about processed records in shown under Status. 


Process Mode - Select Generate Audit Reports Only to produce reports showing current cumulative values. 


                         - Select Clear Values with No Audit Reports to have cumulative values cleared without generating reports.


                        - Select Generate Reports & Clear Values to produce reports showing current cumulative values and to                                         subsequently clear the values. 


                         - If only the option to Clear Out of Tolerance Counter is selected, no report is produced and Process Mode                                 selection is disabled. 


Process - Click the Process button to initiate period end processing. 


             - Depending on the options selected, reports will be produced showing current cumulative values and / or                               cumulative values will be cleared.



If any of the Process Modes which involve values being reset is selected, a confirmation dialog is displayed before values are cleared: -


If any of the Process Modes which involve report generation is selected, a tabbed dialog showing reports for all selected tables is displayed. Select the required report in the left-hand pane for it to appear in the right-hand pane: -


The report list will not be visible if a single table was selected for reporting: -

title: SmartVision Quantity on Order
Replacing an Existing ID with a New ID
text: You can use the Find and Replace Utility to: Change the ID of a customer, employee, material, vendor, work center, location, GL account number, bank code, tax name, or sales code anywhere it is used in JobBOSS. Change multiple material IDs at once using a text file. For example, you might need to do this if one of your customers changes the name of its business. If the ID you want to change it to already exists in JobBOSS, see Merging an Existing ID into Another Existing ID instead. What happens when I replace an ID? When you replace an existing ID with a new ID in JobBOSS: The change affects all instances of that ID in the JobBOSS database, including historical items (such as closed jobs and POs). No record of the change exists in JobBOSS. Only the specified ID field changes. Any associated fields remain unchanged. (For example, if you change a Customer ID, the customer's Name remains as-is). If you use an accounting solution other than JobBOSS Accounting, you are responsible for making the corresponding change in your accounting software. Before using the Find and Replace Utility: Verify that the version of the utility matches your JobBOSS version. Using the wrong version of the utility can affect the integrity of your database. Notify all users to log off of JobBOSS. Back up the JobBOSS database that will be affected by the Find and Replace Utility. The Find and Replace Utility does not allow you to undo your changes. If a mistake is made, you can restore the database from the backup file, then make the change as originally intended.
description:
You can use the Find and Replace Utility to:

  • Change the ID of a customer, employee, material, vendor, work center, location, GL account number, bank code, tax name, or sales code anywhere it is used in JobBOSS.
  • Change multiple material IDs at once using a text file. 

For example, you might need to do this if one of your customers changes the name of its business.


If the ID you want to change it to already exists in JobBOSS, see Merging an Existing ID into Another Existing ID instead.

What happens when I replace an ID?

 

When you replace an existing ID with a new ID in JobBOSS:

  • The change affects all instances of that ID in the JobBOSS database, including historical items (such as closed jobs and POs).
  • No record of the change exists in JobBOSS.
  • Only the specified ID field changes. Any associated fields remain unchanged. (For example, if you change a Customer ID, the customer's Name remains as-is).
  • If you use an accounting solution other than JobBOSS Accounting, you are responsible for making the corresponding change in your accounting software. 

Before using the Find and Replace Utility:

  • Verify that the version of the utility matches your JobBOSS version. Using the wrong version of the utility can affect the integrity of your database.
  • Notify all users to log off of JobBOSS.
  • Back up the JobBOSS database that will be affected by the Find and Replace Utility. The Find and Replace Utility does not allow you to undo your changes. If a mistake is made, you can restore the database from the backup file, then make the change as originally intended.

title: Unable to locate the version of the Visual C++ Redistributable package
text: Error during the installation of the SmartVision Client on a pc: - The SmartVision client requires a version of the C++ software to be installed on the pc on which you are installing the SmartVision Client. You can install the required version from the C++ Runtime folder in the SmartVision media folder: - Once installed reboot the pc and run the SmartVision Client installation once again.
description:
Error during the installation of the SmartVision Client on a pc: - 



The SmartVision client requires a version of the C++ software to be installed on the pc on which you are installing the SmartVision Client.


You can install the required version from the C++ Runtime folder in the SmartVision media folder: -




Once installed reboot the pc and run the SmartVision Client installation once again.

title: SmartVision Client ODBC Administrator
text: The SmartVision Client ODBC Administrator is a new utility designed to help with initial configuration of 64-bit and 32-bit SmartVision Company DSNs when new SmartVision client installations are being undertaken. The program can be found in the SmartVision client bin folder and has the name: K3BTG.SmartVision.Client.OdbcAdministrator.exe Since execution of the program requires administrative privileges, a User Account Control dialog will be displayed upon launching the program: Click the Yes button to allow the SmartVision Client ODBC Administrator program to proceed. If the SmartVision Client ODBC Administrator is unable to confirm the path to the folder that contains the MAX.EXE and/or MAXDSNDP.INI files, a dialog is displayed giving the option to enter a new path. Click the Yes button to allow a different folder to be selected Navigate to the required folder and click the Open button to select the desired path. Note: The path to the folder containing the MAX.EXE file should be defined using UNC format. The SmartVision Client ODBC Administrator will then check all SmartVision Companies defined in the installation and report any errors detected. E.g. If any DSNs are missing, these will be created automatically by the SmartVision Client ODBC Administrator. On a 32-bit machine, only 32-bit DSNs are relevant. On a 64-bit client, 32-bit and 64-bit DSNs will be created if they are found to be missing. Finally, a window will be displayed showing details of the SmartVision Companies detected and the DNSs now present. Click the X button in the top-right corner to close the dialog and exit the program.
description:
The SmartVision Client ODBC Administrator is a new utility designed to help with initial configuration of 64-bit and 32-bit SmartVision Company DSNs when new SmartVision client installations are being undertaken. 


The program can be found in the SmartVision client bin folder and has the name:


K3BTG.SmartVision.Client.OdbcAdministrator.exe


Since execution of the program requires administrative privileges, a User Account Control dialog will be displayed upon launching the program: 



Click the Yes button to allow the SmartVision Client ODBC Administrator program to proceed. 


If the SmartVision Client ODBC Administrator is unable to confirm the path to the folder that contains the MAX.EXE and/or MAXDSNDP.INI files, a dialog is displayed giving the option to enter a new path.


Click the Yes button to allow a different folder to be selected 



Navigate to the required folder and click the Open button to select the desired path. 


Note: The path to the folder containing the MAX.EXE file should be defined using UNC format. 


The SmartVision Client ODBC Administrator will then check all SmartVision Companies defined in the installation and report any errors detected.

E.g.

 


If any DSNs are missing, these will be created automatically by the SmartVision Client ODBC Administrator. On a 32-bit machine, only 32-bit DSNs are relevant. 


On a 64-bit client, 32-bit and 64-bit DSNs will be created if they are found to be missing. Finally, a window will be displayed showing details of the SmartVision Companies detected and the DNSs now present.



Click the X button in the top-right corner to close the dialog and exit the program.

title: 64-bit DSNs for SmartVision Reports
text: When creating reports for SmartVision either with Crystal Report Writer or via an Microsoft Excel Query you will need a 64-bit DSN for the SmartVision database that you are reporting on. You can create a 64-bit DSN by running the K3BTG.SmartVision.Client.Odbc.Administrator.exe The details are in the Knowledge Base link below: - Helpdesk : K3 Support
description:
When creating reports for SmartVision either with Crystal Report Writer or via an Microsoft Excel Query you will need a 64-bit DSN for the SmartVision database that you are reporting on.

title: MRP won't run
text: If you get this error message: You should be able to reset the Next Planned Order Number to ‘400000’ using System Settings: As indicated in the error message an ‘MRP Regen’ will then need to be run prior to carrying out the MRP run.
description:
If you get this error message:



You should be able to reset the Next Planned Order Number to ‘400000’ using System Settings:
 
 
 
As indicated in the error message an ‘MRP Regen’ will then need to be run prior to carrying out the MRP run.
